channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Verizon offers $20 account credits for 1.5 million customers outraged by mysterious 10-hour-long service outage. Here’s how to get the credit
item.description: The company noted the credit, on average, “covers multiple days of service.”

item.title: America’s $952 billion annual burden: Exploding interest on national debt is set to surpass Medicare spending within the decade
item.description: The staggering math behind the rapid rise in interest due on our outsize debt.

item.title: Trump’s immigrant visa crackdown targets Southeast Asia’s Cambodia and Thailand, a decision experts find ‘puzzling’
item.description: “The policy appears less focused on managing migration volumes than on political signaling," says Tan Sook Rei of James Cook University.

item.title: Trump’s ‘Department of War’ rebrand could cost $125 million to replace all the stationery and signs, the CBO says
item.description: A conservative estimate would be $10m, wrote the Congressional Budget Office, but depends on how aggressive the Department of War wants to be with its...

item.title: An NFL-bound college quarterback just turned down a $50 million payday to stay in school and play another season
item.description: More college athletes are putting off going pro amid the growing appeal of and opportunity for NIL deals.

item.title: Economic calendar: Jobless claims, delayed import-prices report and more on tap
How Trump’s one-year cap on credit-card rates affects loyalty points and miles
Nasdaq pacing stock-market rebound as Taiwan Semi earnings reignite AI trade
Taiwan Semiconductor stock soars, driving tech higher after blowout results
First-time jobless claims drop below 200,000 threshold. That’s a key level.
